sub.title: Adult Dosing
sub.mono:
• Cystography, Detection of vesicoureteral reflux: 18.5 to 37 megabecquerels (0.5 to 1 millicuries) direct instillation into bladder via urethral catheter followed by 200 mL sterile saline catheter flush
  • Radiography of nasolacrimal duct: 3.7 megabecquerels (100 microcuries) MAX instilled as OPHTHALMIC drops via micropipette or similar method
  • Radionuclide salivary gland imaging procedure: 37 to 185 megabecquerels (1 to 5 millicuries) IV
  • Radionuclide thyroid imaging: 37 to 370 megabecquerels (1 to 10 millicuries) IV

sub.title: Pediatric Dosing
sub.mono:
• Cystography, Detection of vesicoureteral reflux: 18.5 to 37 megabecquerels (0.5 to 1 millicuries) direct instillation into bladder via urethral catheter followed by 200 mL sterile saline catheter flush
  • Radionuclide thyroid imaging: 2.22 to 2.96 megabecquerels (60 to 80 microcuries)/kg body weight IV

sub.title: Dose Adjustments
sub.mono: geriatric: start at low end of dosing range

sub.title: Indications
sub.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
  • Cystography, Detection of vesicoureteral reflux
  • Radiography of nasolacrimal duct
  • Radionuclide salivary gland imaging procedure
  • Radionuclide thyroid imaging

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: specific contraindications have not been determined

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• children; radiation risks greater for children than adults due to greater absorption and longer life expectancy, particularly in younger children; benefit/risk assessment for children must be considered
  • microbial growth; the eluate does not contain an antimicrobial agent; eluate should not be used after 12 hours from the time of generator elution
  • nasolacrimal imaging procedure; upon termination of the procedure, blowing nose and washing eyes with sterile distilled water or isotonic sodium chloride solution can minimize the radiation dose
  • radiopharmaceutical; may increase risk of cancer with long-term cumulative exposure; handle with care and use safety measures to reduce radiation exposure to personnel and patient

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono:
• AAP: Radioactive compounds that require temporary cessation of breastfeeding.
  • WHO: Avoid breastfeeding.
  • Micromedex: Milk effects are possible.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Sodium pertechnetate Tc 99m is a diagnostic radiopharmaceutical that distributes throughout both the circulatory system and various organs, thereby enabling radiographic imaging for specific blood pool, organ perfusion, and major vessel studies.

3.title: Excretion
3.mono: Renal: fraction promptly excreted after intravascular/extracellular equilibrium

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
General Information
  • use proper procedures for handling and disposal of radiopharmaceuticals
  • expiration of drug is not later than 12 hours after elution
  • if eluate is used to reconstitute a kit for preparation, the kit should not be used 12 hours after kit reconstitution takes place or after the expiration time on labeling for the prepared drug, whichever is earlier
  • wear waterproof gloves during handling procedure and perform all operations aseptically
  • remove needle seal from charge well; discard as radioactive waste
  • remove seal of eluant charge vial, swab, and insert vial into charge well, assuring firm insertion
  • open shield base and insert eluate collection vial, screw base back on securely, and swab exposed vial septum
  • remove vented needle cover from well and discard as radioactive waste
  • insert shielded collection vial in collect well, within elution commencing within 30 seconds
  • allow generator to elute at least 3 minutes after charge has drained, or for a total of 6 minutes
  • after elution, remove shield on collection vial
  • obtain the collect needle seal vial, swab the septum, and insert over the collection needle
  • attach appropriate radioactivity labels and do not use eluate later than 1 working day from time of elution (12 hours)
  • use a shielded syringe when introducing the drug solution into mixing vials
